head.title: DISNEY AND WEINSTEINS TO OPERATE MIRAMAX BOOKS

hedline.hl1: DISNEY AND WEINSTEINS TO OPERATE MIRAMAX BOOKS

abstract.p: Miramax Books will be managed over next two years by publishing executives representing Walt Disney Co and Weinstein brothers, resolving unsettled issue in split of Harvey and Bob Weinstein from Disney; Weinsteins will retain financial interest in books that are scheduled for publication by Miramax and published before Sept 30, 2007; Rob Weisbach, vice president and editor at Simon & Schuster, is appointed president and chief executive of Miramax Books and new Weinstein imprint; Disney executives Robert Miller and Deborah Dugan will oversee acquisition of new books for Disney's publishing operations (S)

block.p: Miramax Books will be managed over the next two years by publishing executives representing both the Walt Disney Company and the Weinstein brothers, the companies said yesterday, resolving an unsettled issue in the split of Harvey and Bob Weinstein from Disney. The Weinsteins will retain a financial interest in books that are scheduled for publication by Miramax and published before Sept. 30, 2007. Rob Weisbach, a vice president and editor at large at Simon & Schuster, was appointed president and chief executive of Miramax Books and the new Weinstein imprint. Two Disney executives will oversee the acquisition of new books for Disney's publishing operations. They are Robert Miller, president of Hyperion Books, and Deborah Dugan, president of Disney Publishing Worldwide.
